title: Kodaikanal
subTitle: Tamil Nadu
description: Kodaikanal, often referred to as the Princess of Hill Stations, is a charming hill station located in the Palani Hills of the Western Ghats in Tamil Nadu. Established in 1845 by British bureaucrats, it has since become a popular retreat for those seeking respite from the heat of the plains. Kodaikanal is known for its lush greenery, mist-covered hills, and picturesque lakes.
bestTimeToVisit: The perfect time to experience Kodaikanal is from March to May and September to November. The weather is generally pleasant throughout the year.

connectivity.bus: Kodaikanal Bus Station, in Kodaikanal town.
connectivity.train: Kodai Road Railway Station, about 80 KM away.
connectivity.flight: Madurai International Airport, about 115 KM away.

details.title: Kodaikanal Lake
description: Kodaikanal Lake is a star-shaped man-made lake and one of the main attractions in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. It was created in 1863 by Sir Vere Henry Levinge, the then Collector of Madurai, and has since become the heart of the town.
The lake offers various boating options, including rowboats, pedal boats, and motorboats, making it a popular activity for visitors.
The 5-kilometer path around the lake is perfect for cycling, walking, and horse riding, providing scenic views of the surrounding hills and greenery.

details.title: Bryant Park
description: Bryant Park is a beautifully landscaped botanical garden located near Kodaikanal Lake in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. Established in 1908 by H.D. Bryant, a forest officer from Madurai, this park is a must-visit for nature enthusiasts and those looking to enjoy the serene environment.
The park boasts a wide variety of flowers, plants, and trees, including exotic species. A stunning glasshouse filled with vibrant flowers and plants, often used for horticultural shows.
A dedicated section showcasing different varieties of roses. Botanical The park is home to over 325 species of trees, shrubs, and cacti.

Held every May, the flower show attracts visitors from all over with its beautiful displays and competitions. Bryant Park is an excellent place to unwind, take leisurely walks, and appreciate the beauty of nature.

details.title: Coakers Walk
description: Coaker's Walk is a beautiful and scenic pedestrian path located on the slopes of Kodaikanal, offering stunning views of the valleys and mountains. It was constructed in 1872 by Lt. Coaker and has since become one of the most popular attractions in Kodaikanal.
Approximately 1 kilometer. The path provides several viewpoints where you can see the rolling hills, green valleys, and even the distant plains on a clear day.

There is a telescope house along the walk that allows visitors to get a closer view of the surrounding landscapes. Coaker's Walk is an ideal spot to witness the sunrise and sunset, with the golden hues casting a magical glow over the landscape.

details.title: Guna Caves
description: The Guna Caves, also known as Devil's Kitchen, are a fascinating natural wonder located in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. These caves are nestled between the Pillar Rocks and are known for their mysterious and eerie atmosphere.

The caves were discovered in 1821 by British officer B.S. Ward and were initially named Devil's Kitchen due to local folklore. They gained widespread fame after featuring in the Tamil film Gunaa starring Kamal Haasan in 1991

The caves are notorious for their deep crevices and dangerous holes, leading to several mysterious disappearances over the years. As a result, the entrance to the caves has been sealed off for safety.
Despite the restrictions, the area around the caves offers stunning views of the Pillar Rocks and lush greenery, making it a popular spot for visitors.

details.title: Pillar Rocks
description: Pillar Rocks is one of Kodaikanal's most iconic and picturesque attractions. These three vertically positioned granite boulders stand majestically, offering stunning views of the surrounding landscape.
Each rock pillar stands around 400 feet tall. The area provides panoramic views of the lush green valleys and hills, especially beautiful during sunrise and sunset.
There is a small garden nearby, adding to the scenic beauty and providing a pleasant spot for picnics. The rocks are often shrouded in mist, creating an enchanting and mysterious atmosphere.
The Pillar Rocks offer a great spot for photography, leisurely walks, and simply enjoying the natural beauty of Kodaikanal.

details.title: Pine Forest
description: The Pine Forest in Kodaikanal is a serene and picturesque destination, known for its lush greenery and tranquil atmosphere. Located in the southwestern part of Kodaikanal, this forest is home to hundreds of tall, majestic pine trees that create a beautiful, natural canopy.

The forest offers a peaceful environment with the soothing sounds of nature, making it an ideal spot for long walks and relaxation. With its dense pine trees and scenic views, the Pine Forest is a favorite location for photographers and filmmakers.

You can enjoy horse riding along the trails within the forest, adding to the adventure. The forest is also known for its vegetation of mushrooms, often referred to as magic mushrooms though they are not for consumption.

details.title: Moir Point
description: Moir Point is a popular viewpoint in Kodaikanal, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding hills and valleys. It is named after Sir Thomas Moir, who constructed the Goschen Road in 1929. The point is located on the way to Berijam Lake and is a favorite spot for tourists and nature lovers.
The viewpoint provides panoramic views of the highest peaks around Kodaikanal, making it a perfect spot for photography.
A monument at Moir Point commemorates Sir Thomas Moir and the construction of the Goschen Road. The area is peaceful and ideal for relaxing and enjoying the natural beauty.

details.title: Mannavanur Lake
description: Mannavanur Lake is a serene and picturesque spot located about 34 kilometers from Kodaikanal in Tamil Nadu, India. It's nestled amidst lush green meadows and majestic hills, making it a perfect destination for nature lovers.

The lake is surrounded by eucalyptus and pine trees, and you can often spot various birds and even some wild animals in the area. The lake is surrounded by beautiful hills and meadows, offering stunning views. You can enjoy activities like picnicking, coracle rides, horse riding, and bird watching.

The lake is located inside a sheep farm, so you might see flocks of sheep grazing around. The area is known for its vegetable cultivation, including carrots, cauliflower, cabbage, peas, potatoes, and more. It's an ideal place to relax and enjoy the tranquility of nature.

details.title: Berijam Lake
details.address: Old Site Of Fort Hamilton, Kodaikanal
description: Berijam Lake is another beautiful spot near Kodaikanal in Tamil Nadu, India. It's located about 23 kilometers southwest of Kodaikanal and is known for its serene and picturesque setting. The lake is surrounded by lush greenery, including acacia and pine trees, making it a perfect spot for nature lovers.

You can enjoy activities like bird watching, picnicking, and nature walks. Fishing is also allowed with permission from the Fisheries Department. The area around the lake is home to various wildlife, including bison, deer, snakes, elephants, and monkeys. Bird enthusiasts can spot species like crested serpent eagles, pariah kites, and migratory birds like the common rosefinch and blue chat.

The lake is located at the old site of Fort Hamilton, and there's a 100-year-old brick building that's worth a visit. To visit Berijam Lake, you'll need a forest pass, which can be obtained from the District Forest Office in Kodaikanal. Only a limited number of visitors are allowed each day.

details.title: Dolphin Nose
description: Dolphin's Nose in Kodaikanal is a stunning viewpoint located about 8 kilometers from the town, at an altitude of 6,600 feet. The name comes from a flat rock that juts out like a dolphin's nose, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding valleys and hills.

You can enjoy panoramic views of the Pambar Valley, Periyakulam town, and Vaigai Lake. Reaching Dolphin's Nose involves a one-kilometer trek from Vattakanal, which is a great way to immerse yourself in nature.
The spot is quite secluded and undisturbed, providing a serene and calming environment. The best time to visit is between October and March when the weather is pleasant.

details.title: Silent Valley View Point
description: Silent Valley View Point is a breathtaking spot located on Berijam Lake Road in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. It offers mesmerizing views of the deep valleys and lush green meadows, often covered in a mystical mist.

The view point offers panoramic views of the Palani hills and the Western Ghats, with lush green valleys in between. Early mornings and late afternoons are ideal times to visit, as the mist and clouds add to the enchanting atmosphere.
It's a great spot for photography, picnicking, and simply enjoying the serene environment. The view point is well-connected by road, and you can reach it by taxi, bike, or on foot.

details.title: Green Valley View Point
description: Green Valley View Point, also known as Suicide Point, is a popular viewpoint in Kodaikanal, Tamil Nadu. It offers breathtaking views of the deep valleys and surrounding hills. The view point offers panoramic views of the plains, deep valleys, and hills. You can also see the Vaigai Dam if the weather is clear.

The best time to visit is between 10:00 AM and 3:00 PM, as the mist and clouds can obstruct the view later in the day. The area is fenced with iron bars for safety, as the valley below is more than 5000 feet deep.
You might encounter monkeys at the viewpoint, so be cautious with your belongings. There are several shops selling homemade chocolates, ornaments, and flowers on the way to the viewpoint.
